intro: Iresine keyensis, commonly known as the red-stemmed iron plant, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often red or purple on the underside, giving it a unique visual appeal. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white. Iresine keyensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
